£38 FRITA BATIDOS

FRESH GINGER-LIME JUICE MANGO / PASSION FRUIT

FRESH SQUEEZED LEMONADE GUAVA / LYCHEE

COCONUT-LIME / HIBISCUS COKE / COKE LIGHT
SPRITE / FANTA ORANGE

FRITA BATIDOS is inspired by Cuban culture and a fantasy revolving
around two staples in the world of Cuban street food — The FRITA — a
burger traditionally made from spicy chorizo served with shoestring fries
on top in a soft egg bun and BATIDOS — tropical milkshakes made with
fresh fruit, crushed ice, and sweetened milk — with or without rum! Like
burgers and shakes, Fritas and Batidos are a natural pairing and the
whimsical menu is the result of dreaming about these two dishes for years!
Although Frita Batidos is casual, it is vitally important to us to maintain the
highest standards and aspirations for taste, quality and creativity. Frita
Batidos is run by a community. We thank you — friends, family, partners,
extended restaurant family and voracious culinary community — for
helping bring to fruition what started as a day dream, grew into an
obsession and is finally a reality!

17 WEST WASHINGTON ST. ANN ARBOR, MI 48104 PH 734.761.2882 WWW.FRITABATIDOS.COM

Address: 117 W Washington St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Open & airy space with picnic table seating serving colorful Cuban street food & tropical cocktails.

summary.snippet: "Tasty food, good service, good location close to the parking lot."
"After we paid and were eating, we realized we did not get the happy hour price."
"We ordered fish, beef (hamburger) and chicken sandwiches."

most_relevant.description:
Awesome burger, price is up there though. Probably expect to pay like $18/person here, but worth it. One of the few places in Ann Arbor that actually tastes good, and you can tell they use high quality ingredients.
Probably not a good first date spot, the burgers get messy, especially if you’re a big back and get a double patty

5 stars before I even taste my frita, a traditional Cuban burger. Very cool, huge, spacious place,  big picnic tables to share with, bar on one side, outdoor seating too. Great easy to navigate menu and cuban music playing throughout. Staff was awesomely friendly. Ordered fish frita. And as delicious as I thought.

What a fantastic meal. Omg. I seriously can’t believe how good this was. My chicken sandwich was out of this world! The coconut batido was the most delicious cold drink I’ve ever had. I seriously can’t wait to go back here. Even on a very busy day after a U of M game, the service was quick and efficient. Food was literally off the chain. I cannot wait to return.

This is an iconic spot in Ann Arbor. I’ve heard about it from the East Coast, so I had to try it out. I very much enjoyed the Cuban burger, the plantains, and the cold beverage. I will say that because I came into this restaurant with super high expectations, I wasn’t blown away after I left. However, I did enjoy everything I had, and I will come back. If you’re looking for good Cuban burgers or a spot that everyone talks about, this place is it.
The food was excellent!  The tropical coleslaw and the garlic cilantro fries were the best I have ever had! Can't wait to come back and try a few more things on their menu!

Amazing food, really. Worth every penny. Has plenty non vegetarian options. For vegetarian, it only has the black beans patty burger. But this burger is really a treat. We also tried the coconut cream batidos, it was a fresh experience

For the non vegetarian options, ‘the best snack ever’ is a good option.

The only negative of this place was the long waiting queue for placing the order. Otherwise, 10/10 recommended.

The food was absolutely delicious. The drinks were so good that if we lived in the area it would be worth stopping in just for the drinks. Very quick service with all the food being delivered hot to your table after placing our order at the counter. Plenty of room to eat but with all the customers it was a bit noisy.

A  very unexpected pleasure. Our server Roger was awesome, and he gave pointers for parking. Combination of all different regions with a Cuban flair. food is outrageous! if in the ann arbor / Detroit area this is a must visit. Friendly helpful staff, order at counter, they bring it out to you. Very knowledgeable about menu items. parking close is street parking 430-530pm best time to find it. May have to go to parking garage. either way worth it.
